page.title: 04STORNOWAY SOUTH - TOURISM
page.content: {THE CASTLE GROUNDS.}Across the harbour from Stornoway stands{Lady Lever Park, better known locally as the Castle Grounds which are open to the public. The Grounds cover 30 acres. In 1844 a man called{James Sutherland {Matheson}bought the island of Lewis which had been treeless for 2000 years. James Matheson planted what turned out to be one of the most finest woods in the west of Scotland. Many people enjoy looking at nature in the Castle Grounds when they go out for walks. You can see over 50 diffrent kinds of{trees}and more than 90 different types of{birds.}There are a few long{trails}in the Castle Grounds. The{Willowglen trail}can be from 2.25 - 3 miles. The{River Creed {Trail}can be 3.75 - 6 miles. The highest point is{Gallows Hill,}once used as a place of execution.
